description: Danzy Senna was born in 1970, just a few years after Loving v. Virginia legalized interracial marriage. “Just merely existing as a family was a radical statement at that time,” she says.
title: 'I want to write myself into existence,' says 'Colored Television' author

description: A beloved beluga whale with a mysterious past was found dead in the waters of Norway over the weekend. Admirers are paying tribute as authorities investigate.
title: Beloved 'Russian spy whale' Hvaldimir is found dead under mysterious circumstances

description: Farmers are often "land rich, cash poor." Those who need nursing home care might have to sell or break up their farm to pay for it.
title: Why farmers worry about the costs of long-term care

description: Joey Chestnut faced off against Takeru Kobayashi in a Netflix showdown on Monday. Chestnut downed 83 hot dogs and buns to Kobayashi's 66 in 10 minutes, beating his own world record from 2021.
title: Top dog Joey Chestnut beats his archrival and his own hot dog-eating world record

description: Two Russian ballistic missiles struck a military training facility and nearby hospital in a central-eastern region of Ukraine, killing at least 41 people and wounding 180 others, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Tuesday.
title: A Russian missile strike has killed over 40 people in Ukrainian city of Poltava

description: After a 4-year-old boy broke a 3,500-year-old vase, a museum in Israel viewed it as an educational opportunity and invited him and his family back to learn about how they would restore the item.
title: Israeli boy who broke an ancient jar learns how the museum is piecing it back together

description: From salamanders and salmon to bears and mountain lions, David Herasimtschuk's images illustrate not only the beauty of the forests and their creatures but the symbiotic relationships that are vital to the forests’ health and the planet’s welfare.
title: A photographer captures life in America’s last remaining old-growth forests

description: Nearly 300 young musicians, their teachers and staff from their music school fled Afghanistan in fear for their lives as the Taliban took power. NPR caught up with them during their U.S. tour,
title: Whatever happened to ... the young Afghan musicians who fled after the Taliban took over?

description: Voting starts in the presidential election within just a few weeks. Here's what to watch out for in the post-Labor Day campaign sprint. And, thousands of hotel workers are pressing for higher wages.
title: What to look for ahead of Election Day. And, why hotel workers are on strike

description: Economists used AI to analyze millions of yearbook photos. They discovered ties are no longer cool…and also a new frontier for economic analysis.
title: What can we learn from millions of high school yearbook photos?

description: The campaign known as “Spamouflage” includes accounts claiming to be American voters and U.S. soldiers posting about hot-button topics including abortion, Israel and Ukraine.
title: China is pushing divisive political messages online using fake U.S. voters

description: Former LA Mayor Eric Garcetti denies he knew about a top adviser's alleged abuse at City Hall. An NPR investigation raises new questions about whether the now U.S. ambassador to India lied under oath.
title: Did a powerful Democrat lie about #MeToo allegations to save his career?

description: A provisional assessment showed that 24 inmates were shot dead by “warning” gunshots as they tried to escape from the overcrowded Makala Central Prison in Kinshasa early Monday, the government said.
title: Congo says at least 129 people died during an attempted jailbreak

description: The suspect initially escaped from the scene, but was later found through Chicago Transit Authority  surveillance video. Police now have the person in custody and seized a firearm in their possession.
title: 4 people were killed on a train in the Chicago area on Labor Day, police say

description: The pope's arrival in Indonesia launches an 11-day voyage zigzagging across time zones that will also take him to Papua New Guinea, East Timor and Singapore.
title: Pope opens Asia odyssey in Indonesia to rally Catholics, hail religious tolerance
